p:
To account for different rates of sexual transmission between sexes, we take the male-to-female transmission rate to be the baseline, the most effective, due to the larger inoculum. We denote it by
β S
and define
k
W W
,
k
W M
,
k
M M
, and
k L
to be a ratio of this baseline transmission contributed by other modes of sexual transmission, respectively woman-to-woman, woman-to-man, man-to-man, and latent-man-to-woman. We further assume these ratios to range from 0–1, meaning the other modes can at most be as effective as the male-to-female transmission.
